result.execSummary:
The defendant Devontae R. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: ANY UNPAID COURT OBLIGATIONS ARE STILL TO BE COLLECTED

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.

records.addlTxt: Defts probation is extended for 1 year from 9-1-16 to 9-1-17 or until all court obligations are completed.  Nunc pro tunc 8/26/16.  After a hearing on 8-26-16 at which extension was ordered.

and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and hearing and Order Extending Probation.  Deft's probation is extended for 1 year from 9-1-16 to 9-1-17 or until all court obligations are completed.

No record made.  No appearance by the State.  Def. appeared without counsel.  Probation agent Stacy Wagner appeared.  Def. still owes around $450 in unpaid financial obligations.  Probation extended for one year to 9/1/17.  (Copy of court record sent to DOC-Kenosha.)

records.addlTxt: Wisconsin Uniform Citation
Ct. 2
Cts 1 & 3
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Koesser.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 1 & 3 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court imposes and stays a total sentence of 2 years WSP; 1 1/2 years initial confinement; 6 months extended supervision; deft placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Atty Hans Koesser

*Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.
